subject: Re: [junit] how to get ant sysproperties
msgSnippet: David, with System.getProperty( var ); I am able to get the value assigned, I want to know how long that variable will be available for me, But my question is
messageBody:
David,

with System.getProperty("var"); I am able to get the value assigned, I want to know how long that variable will be available for me, But my question is how long this variable available for me?
Is it for the entire ant session or just for single JVM? If I have 10 test cases in my junit batchtest..
10 jvms will come into picture.. I want this value to be available to all the jvms..

thanks
Shubha



----- Original Message ----
From: David Saff <saff@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 1, 2007 6:32:49 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] how to get ant sysproperties

Shubha,

Are you saying that you've run the following, executed
System.getProperty( ), and it's coming back undefined? Thanks for
helping me understand,

David Saff

On 3/31/07, Shubha B S <mailtoshubha@ yahoo.com> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am using ant to run my testcases, target in ant looks like this.
>
>
>
> <target name="run-tests" description= "Run the model layer Unit tests"
> depends="compile, copy" >
> <junit printsummary= "true" fork="false" haltonfailure= "off"
> haltonerror= "off">
> <formatter usefile="true" type="xml"/>
> <batchtest fork="false" haltonfailure= "off" haltonerror= "off"
> todir="${tests. reporting. dir}">
> <fileset dir="classes" >
> <exclude name = "**/AllTests. class"/>
> <include name = "**/Calculator. class"/>
> <exclude name = "**/test.class" />
> </fileset>
> </batchtest>
> <sysproperty key="jbo.debugoutpu t" value="file" />
> <classpath refid="test. classpath" />
> <classpath refid="Calculator. classpath" />
> <classpath location="${ output.dir} "/>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> my java program say "Calculator" testcase want to access the sysproperty (eg jbo.debugoutput) of ant. How can this be achieved? Is this sysproperty is for the entire ant session?
>
> thanks
> Shubha
>
>
